oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Arctic bramble, berry with unique aroma is a rich source of phytochemicals. Cultivation is still problematic
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Kokko, Harri
Hukkanen, Anne
Kostamo, Katri
Markkula, Paavo
Kärenlampi, Sirpa
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The main goal in the cultivation trials is the evaluation of the productivity and downy mildew resistance of a selected arctic bramble clone, which in preliminary trials has shown disease resistance.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Kokko, Harri; Hukkanen, Anne; Kostamo, Katri; Markkula, Paavo and Kärenlampi, Sirpa (2007) Arctic bramble, berry with unique aroma is a rich source of phytochemicals. Cultivation is still problematic. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, p. 45.
